page.title: 05A FLETCHING OCTAGENARIAN(2)
page.content: He has been a voluntary worker at the Bluebell Line since 1959 and loves steam trains. In the Second World War he belonged to the Civil Defence and was awarded a medal for sighting a V1 Rocket that came over Fletching. At 83 he still plays the organ regularly and every morning sets off on his bike to deliver the Royal Mail as he is the local postman. He remembers the first car in the village, owned by the doctor and himself owned one of the first wirelesses (cat's whiskers) He remembers the bus fare to Uckfield being 8d but now it is Â£1.10. Even so he prefers life today_likes T.V. (makes life much more interesting ) and all the new_fangled gadgets but not computers. { by Claire Rutter & Robert Bishop.
